holidays.name: National Everything You Think Is Wrong Day
holidays.description: A day to question all your assumptions and embrace the possibility that you might be wrong about pretty much everything ‚Äî from your favorite pizza topping to your life choices.
holidays.origin: Started as a humorous internet meme turning into an unofficial day to challenge beliefs and spark playful debates.
holidays.funFact: Some people celebrate by deliberately changing their opinions for the day just to see what happens!

holidays.name: Ear Muff Day
holidays.description: Celebrate these cozy winter accessories that keep your ears warm and stylish! Great for acknowledging all things fuzzy and functional.
holidays.origin: Coincides with inventor Chester Greenwood's birthday, who patented the ear muff in 1873.
holidays.funFact: Chester Greenwood made his first ear muffs at age 15 because he hated having cold ears while ice skating!

holidays.name: K-9 Veterans Day
holidays.description: A day to honor the brave military working dogs and their handlers for their service and dedication in the armed forces.
holidays.origin: An official day in the US to recognize the invaluable contributions of canine soldiers worldwide.
holidays.funFact: Military dogs have saved thousands of lives by detecting explosives and protecting soldiers in combat.

holidays.name: National Potato Chip Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the crunchy, salty, and addictive snack that is potato chips! A perfect excuse to indulge in all flavors, from classic to spicy and beyond.
holidays.origin: Commemorates the invention of the potato chip in the mid-19th century, attributed to a chef trying to satisfy a picky customer.
holidays.funFact: Despite popular myth crediting Saratoga chips to 1853, the true origin story of potato chips is still debated among food historians.
